subject: Real Estate
title: The Savings & Loan Crisis
description: A fast breakdown of The Savings & Loan Crisis for builders.

hook.text: In the 1980s, over 1,000 U.S. savings banks collapsed â€” the biggest banking failure before 2008.

buildup.text: Deregulation let savings and loan institutions invest deposits in risky real estate developments.

discovery.text: Bankers made reckless bets knowing depositors were insured by the government. Heads I win, tails you lose.

twist.text: The bailout cost taxpayers $132 billion. Several bankers went to prison, including Charles Keating.

climax.text: The S&L crisis proved that moral hazard in banking always ends with the public paying the bill.

punchline.text: Insured deposits and risky loans are a toxic mix.

quiz.question: What enabled the Savings & Loan crisis?
options: Deregulation allowing risky real estate investments
